1509649171_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
Under "My Repos" it lists all the repos I have visited. How do I remove the ones I don't want to see in the list?

Also when visiting http://gitcenter.bit/ and clicking any of the repos in the index it brings me to a page that says not found. http://gitcenter.bit/1Ps8mZHcKGdwtjmMLBJ9b8KU6ogEBrjEig
It works find when I visit the site using http://zero/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t and clicking any of the links. It redirects me to http://zero/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1Ps8mZHcKGdwtjmMLBJ9b8KU6ogEBrjEig

Thanks guys this helps a lot. I was afraid I would have to manually delete the repos from the data directory. Also this might be worth adding the delete instructions to the "Beginner's Guide" or maybe a FAQ section.
Feature Request: Right now files are sorted alphabetically under Root>. I'd like to see directories sorted first then all other files sorted second.
Thanks gitcenter, it looks so much cleaner.
